results.title: Effective learning in elementary school
results.creator_credit: George L. George and Sturgis-Grant Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Planning for Teaching”.
A teacher in primary school tells of some of her own experiences in making learning more effective. In her class, teacher and pupil work together on the basic skills such as reading and writing. But stronger motivation for learning is derived from unit study projects, which also give pupils opportunities to develop social skills.

results.title: Effective and creative writing: reaching your reader
results.brief_description: An examination of how to appeal to the readers’ senses; how to create dynamic rather than static descriptions; instead of describing emotions for readers, how to make them feel those emotions. A dlightful film, rich in imagery and examples.

results.title: Effacement
results.brief_description: Solrun Hoaas’avant garde poetic tribute to Noh mask maker Taniguchi Akiko emphasises the relationship between the mask maker and her mask. It experiments with the visual and dramatic potential in Noh and in the mask, moving towards abstraction as the mask appears and re-appears in the reflection of a tree, its original substance.

results.title: Edweard Muybridge Horse in Motion
results.brief_description: Muybridge was the first person to render time visible by breaking movement down into increments of time – influencing artists to the present day.

constellations_primary.name: Obviously the time continuum has been disrupted...again and again and again!
constellations_primary.description: Eadweard Muybridge was able to capture time and play it back again creating endless time paradoxes where subjects are destined to repeat their previous actions. Filmmakers have since explored such notions via time travel narratives questioning destiny, fate and choice.

results.description: In reducing shutter speeds down to a fraction of a second, Eadweard Muybridge broke down movement into increments of time. With multiple cameras, Muybridge was able to take sequential photographs – then with the help of a zoetrope and later his zoopraxiscope he effectively created the world’s first moving photographs laying the foundation for creation of the moving image.
description_for_label: In reducing shutter speeds down to a fraction of a second, Eadweard Muybridge broke down movement into increments of time. With multiple cameras, Muybridge was able to take sequential photographs – then with the help of a zoetrope and later his zoopraxiscope he effectively created the world’s first moving photographs laying the foundation for creation of the moving image.

results.title: Edwardian newsreel
results.creator_credit: B F I National Film Library
results.brief_description: Records events and personalities during the reign of Edward VII, compiled from contemporary newsreels. The film covers a wide field of events including the funeral of Queen Victoria, and suffragette disturbances, the Delhi Durbar and finally the funeral of Edward V11.
results.description: Records events and personalities during the reign of Edward VII, compiled from contemporary newsreels. The film covers a wide field of events including the funeral of Queen Victoria, and suffragette disturbances, the Delhi Durbar and finally the funeral of Edward V11.

results.title: Edward scissorhands [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Denise Di Novi and Tim Burton
results.brief_description: A lonely old inventor in a castle upon a hill dies and leaves his greatest creation, a boy called Edward, unfinished. Instead of hands, the boy has sharp shears of metal. Until his rescue by a kindly Avon lady who takes him home to the pastel paradise of suburbia, Edward lives alone in darkness. “Edward Scissorhands” is more than a fairy tale by masterful director Tim Burton. This is a satire/allegory which is both funny and moving. Johnny Depp as Edward is a gentle creature full of pathos, yet dignified; much less a monster than the fickle humans who at first embrace him and then seek to destroy him. Dianne Weist stars as Avon Lady Peg, and Winona Ryder as her daughter, Kim. The sets are typical of Burton’s famed surreal style. “Edward Scissorhands” is a film of great poignancy with its own special beauty.

results.title: Edward Said (Writers in Conversation)
results.brief_description: Edward Said, through much of his work, is concerned with the identity of the Palestinians, a dispersed and dispossessed people attempting to come to terms with exile. In this interview with Salman Rushdie, Edward Said explains the history and evolution of the Palestinian people.
